result.execSummary:
The defendant Marianne P. Dosier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000 [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Receiving or Concealing Stolen Property (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

49 Days Jail Credit if Revoked
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes:
plus 10% restitution surcharge.
Pay $100.00 per month towards restitution.  If behind in payments after 36 months, 1 year cvonditional jail time that was stayed, will need to be served

No contact with R.B., M.R., A.J., T.I.-B., D.D., S.S., D.G., T.H., R.B., or any pawn shops

records.addlTxt: Letter of Completion
of Sentencing Hearing held on April 30, 2021
Probation Revoked - Sentenced to Time Served on 04/30/2021

Cases called at 11:05 AM: 15CF537, 20CF1051.  Hearing held via Zoom video conferencing.
Defendant Marianne P. Dosier appeared in custody from the jail with Attorney Laurie Sazama Osberg. Deputy District Attorney Peter J. Rindal appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Agreement has been reached.   Victim/Witness statute complied with. Defendant waives her right to personal appearance.
Counsel stipulates to the following sentence:
20CF1051:  5 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 5 Years of Extended Supervision on Count 1, and 10 Years of Concurrent Probation on Count 3 (Concurrent to 15CF537 and Buffalo County Case 17CF81).
15CF537:  1 Year of Jail (Concurrent to 20CF1051 and Buffalo County Case 17CF81).
Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights.  Defendant makes a statement to the Court.
15CF537(Sentence After Revocation): Defendant is sentenced to 334 days of jail on Count 4 and Count 5 (Concurrent to one another). Defendant is granted 334 days of credit.
20CF1051: Defendant pleads No Contest to Count 1 and Count 3 as charged in the Information.
Count 1: Defendant is sentenced to 4 Years of Initial Confinement followed by 4 Years of Extended Supervision (concurrent to Eau Claire County Case 15CF537 and Buffalo County Case 17CF81) with the following conditions:
AODA and follow through with recommendations. Maintain absolute sobriety.  No contact with D.S. or any known drug dealers/users except in a therapeutic setting.  Must testify truthfully in any proceedings against any implicated individuals.  Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.  Court costs/surcharges including $280.00 in WCDTF Buy Money.
Count 3: Defendant is sentenced to 285 days of jail (concurrent to Count 1, Eau Claire County Case 15CF537 and Buffalo County Case 17CF81).  
Defendant is granted 285 days of sentence credit.    Remaining charges are dismissed and read in.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on April 30, 2021 at 10:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 25, 2021 at 11:00 am.
